alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson; Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 19 at 10:30AM CDT until April 19 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Jackson County in east central Iowa... Southwestern Dubuque County in northeastern Iowa... Northern Jones County in east central Iowa... * Until 1100 AM CDT. * At 1030 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Pictured Rocks Wildlife Area to near Langworthy, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. **! SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Cascade around 1040 AM CDT. Temple Hill around 1045 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Fillmore, Fillmore Recreation Area, South Gary Owen, Peosta, Bernard and Garry Owen. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
